title: NYT/Sienna final poll says Kamala Harris, Donald Trump tied at 48 per cent popular vote
content: With 10 days left for the 2024 election, a NYT/Sienna College poll reveals a tie between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump at 48% each. Early voting favors Harris significantly, while Trump gains on immigration issues. The poll found that the 9 per cent of Americans who said they already had voted leaned heavily toward Harris -- 59 per cent to 40 per cent. This is a tradition that Democrats generally win in early voting and mail voting.
summary: With 10 days left for the 2024 election, a NYT/Sienna College poll reveals a tie between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump at 48% each. Early voting favors Harris significantly, while Trump gains on immigration issues. The poll found that the 9 per cent of Americans who said they already had voted leaned heavily toward Harris -- 59 per cent to 40 per cent. This is a tradition that Democrats generally win in early voting and mail voting.

title: Japan to resume trial removal of Fukushima nuclear debris: Reports
content: The operator of Japan's stricken Fukushima nuclear plant will resume an operation to remove a sample of highly radioactive material next week, reports said Friday, after having suspended the effort over a technical snag. TEPCO on Friday said it would resume the removal on Monday after replacing the cameras with new ones, the Asahi Shimbun daily and other local media reported.
summary: The operator of Japan's stricken Fukushima nuclear plant will resume an operation to remove a sample of highly radioactive material next week, reports said Friday, after having suspended the effort over a technical snag. TEPCO on Friday said it would resume the removal on Monday after replacing the cameras with new ones, the Asahi Shimbun daily and other local media reported.

title: Why President Biden said that he would apologise to Native Americans
content: President Joe Biden will deliver a formal apology for the U.S. government's role in the boarding school system that forced Indigenous children from their families and subjected them to abuse. The apology, to be made during a visit to the Gila River Indian Community in Arizona, addresses the long-lasting scars inflicted on generations.
summary: President Joe Biden will deliver a formal apology for the U.S. government's role in the boarding school system that forced Indigenous children from their families and subjected them to abuse. The apology, to be made during a visit to the Gila River Indian Community in Arizona, addresses the long-lasting scars inflicted on generations.

title: From rags to riches: Dean Forbes crowned UK’s most influential Black person
content: Dean Forbes, named the UK’s most influential Black individual, leads Forterro, a €2 billion tech firm. From homelessness to CEO, Forbes leverages his platform to advocate for inclusivity and inspire young Black Britons. He also heads a charitable group that raised over £400,000 this year.
summary: Dean Forbes, named the UK’s most influential Black individual, leads Forterro, a €2 billion tech firm. From homelessness to CEO, Forbes leverages his platform to advocate for inclusivity and inspire young Black Britons. He also heads a charitable group that raised over £400,000 this year.

title: Watch: Nasa's SpaceX Dragon spacecraft returns to Earth after 236 days in space
content: NASA's Crew-8 mission has concluded after 236 days in space, as the team successfully splashed down off Pensacola, Florida, in a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft. The mission covered 100 million miles and involved eight spacecraft arrivals and departures at the ISS, underscoring ongoing space station operations.
summary: NASA's Crew-8 mission has concluded after 236 days in space, as the team successfully splashed down off Pensacola, Florida, in a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft. The mission covered 100 million miles and involved eight spacecraft arrivals and departures at the ISS, underscoring ongoing space station operations.

title: Hurricane Kristy strengthens into a Category 5 storm, expected to weaken over open Pacific waters
content: Hurricane Kristy has intensified into a Category 5 storm in the Pacific, becoming the first such storm without El Niño since 2010. Currently moving westward, Kristy is expected to weaken over the weekend but will generate hazardous surf conditions along Baja California's west coast.
summary: Hurricane Kristy has intensified into a Category 5 storm in the Pacific, becoming the first such storm without El Niño since 2010. Currently moving westward, Kristy is expected to weaken over the weekend but will generate hazardous surf conditions along Baja California's west coast.

title: Who is Kari Lake? Journalist-turned-politician whom Bill Clinton finds ‘physically attractive’
content: Kari Lake, Republican US Senate candidate, responded wittily to Bill Clinton's remark calling her 'physically attractive,' referencing his past controversies. Clinton's comment came during a rally in Phoenix supporting Kamala Harris. Lake, a former TV news anchor, previously ran for Arizona governor and is now eyeing the Senate seat against incumbent Kyrsten Sinema and Democrat Ruben Gallego.
summary: Kari Lake, Republican US Senate candidate, responded wittily to Bill Clinton's remark calling her 'physically attractive,' referencing his past controversies. Clinton's comment came during a rally in Phoenix supporting Kamala Harris. Lake, a former TV news anchor, previously ran for Arizona governor and is now eyeing the Senate seat against incumbent Kyrsten Sinema and Democrat Ruben Gallego.

title: What are the lawsuits against McDonald’s over E. coli outbreak linked to Quarter Pounders?
content: McDonald's is facing lawsuits from two individuals who contracted E. coli linked to slivered onions in their Quarter Pounder burgers. The outbreak has affected 49 people across 10 states, resulting in one death. The company has paused onion distribution and initiated a recall.
summary: McDonald's is facing lawsuits from two individuals who contracted E. coli linked to slivered onions in their Quarter Pounder burgers. The outbreak has affected 49 people across 10 states, resulting in one death. The company has paused onion distribution and initiated a recall.

title: Pakistan terror attack: 10 cops shot dead by Taliban at check post near Afghan border
content: Ten police officers were killed and seven injured in a militant attack on a Frontier Constabulary post near Pakistan's Afghan border. The Pakistan Taliban claimed responsibility for the assault in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. The region has seen increased militancy since the Afghan Taliban's return to power in 2021, with frequent attacks targeting security forces.
summary: Ten police officers were killed and seven injured in a militant attack on a Frontier Constabulary post near Pakistan's Afghan border. The Pakistan Taliban claimed responsibility for the assault in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province. The region has seen increased militancy since the Afghan Taliban's return to power in 2021, with frequent attacks targeting security forces.

title: 'Play by the rules': Why Vivek Ramaswamy is pushing for single-day nationwide voting
content: At a rally with Donald Trump, Vivek Ramaswamy proposed single-day nationwide voting with paper ballots and government ID. He urged Republicans to participate in early voting to secure a win, comparing the 2024 election to the American Revolution and Trump to George Washington.
summary: At a rally with Donald Trump, Vivek Ramaswamy proposed single-day nationwide voting with paper ballots and government ID. He urged Republicans to participate in early voting to secure a win, comparing the 2024 election to the American Revolution and Trump to George Washington.

title: Elon Musk fuels Trump campaign with $44 million super PAC donation
content: Elon Musk donated $44 million to a pro-Trump super PAC in early October, bringing his total contributions to $75 million. The funds are part of efforts to boost voter turnout in key states for the upcoming election. Concerns arise as Musk's $1 million daily giveaways may violate federal law, sparking Justice Department scrutiny.
summary: Elon Musk donated $44 million to a pro-Trump super PAC in early October, bringing his total contributions to $75 million. The funds are part of efforts to boost voter turnout in key states for the upcoming election. Concerns arise as Musk's $1 million daily giveaways may violate federal law, sparking Justice Department scrutiny.

title: 'If you wanted to avoid nuclear war then vote ...': How Robert F Kennedy Jr endorsed Trump
content: Politician Robert F Kennedy Jr. urges voters to support Donald Trump to avoid nuclear war, claiming Kamala Harris' presidency would lead to conflict. He criticizes Dick Cheney's endorsement of Harris, drawing parallels with past military interventions and highlighting concerns over Harris' foreign policy experience and potential influence by military factions.
summary: Politician Robert F Kennedy Jr. urges voters to support Donald Trump to avoid nuclear war, claiming Kamala Harris' presidency would lead to conflict. He criticizes Dick Cheney's endorsement of Harris, drawing parallels with past military interventions and highlighting concerns over Harris' foreign policy experience and potential influence by military factions.

title: What is fascism? And why does Harris say Trump is a fascist?
content: Vice President Kamala Harris labels Donald Trump as a fascist, pointing to his admiration of dictators and use of totalitarian tactics. Experts are divided, with some seeing Trump moving towards fascist tendencies, while others believe the label is exaggerated given stronger US democratic institutions.
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris labels Donald Trump as a fascist, pointing to his admiration of dictators and use of totalitarian tactics. Experts are divided, with some seeing Trump moving towards fascist tendencies, while others believe the label is exaggerated given stronger US democratic institutions.

title: Man pleads guilty to displaying a Nazi symbol at pro-Palestinian rally
content: Alan Yazbek has pleaded guilty to displaying a Nazi symbol during a pro-Palestinian rally in Sydney on October 6. He faces potential jail time or a fine. The rally gathered around 10,000 attendees, and Jewish groups report a rise in anti-Semitic incidents in Australia amid Middle East tensions.
summary: Alan Yazbek has pleaded guilty to displaying a Nazi symbol during a pro-Palestinian rally in Sydney on October 6. He faces potential jail time or a fine. The rally gathered around 10,000 attendees, and Jewish groups report a rise in anti-Semitic incidents in Australia amid Middle East tensions.

title: A car bomb explodes outside a police station in western Mexico, wounding 3 officers
content: A car bomb attack outside a police station in Acambaro, Guanajuato, wounds three people, including a woman and her daughter. Another explosion in Jerecuaro causes significant damage but no injuries. These attacks are linked to ongoing cartel violence, challenging new President Sheinbaum's policy of avoiding direct confrontation with drug cartels.
summary: A car bomb attack outside a police station in Acambaro, Guanajuato, wounds three people, including a woman and her daughter. Another explosion in Jerecuaro causes significant damage but no injuries. These attacks are linked to ongoing cartel violence, challenging new President Sheinbaum's policy of avoiding direct confrontation with drug cartels.

title: Israel kills Mohammad Abu Itiwi, Hamas commander involved in October 7 attack
content: Israel's military killed Hamas commander Mohammad Abu Itiwi, who was involved in the Oct 7, 2023, attack on southern Israel and employed by UNRWA. The Israeli military had alerted UNRWA about suspected affiliations of their staff with armed groups, escalating tensions between Israel and the agency.
summary: Israel's military killed Hamas commander Mohammad Abu Itiwi, who was involved in the Oct 7, 2023, attack on southern Israel and employed by UNRWA. The Israeli military had alerted UNRWA about suspected affiliations of their staff with armed groups, escalating tensions between Israel and the agency.

title: Menendez brothers: Prosecutor urges resentencing, parole in 1989 parents' murder case
content: The Menendez brothers may become eligible for parole after District Attorney George Gascón suggested resentencing for their 1989 conviction for murdering their parents. New evidence, including a letter by Erik Menendez alleging sexual abuse by their father, has reignited the case. Gascón emphasized the consideration of abuse claims, recommending 50 years to life.
summary: The Menendez brothers may become eligible for parole after District Attorney George Gascón suggested resentencing for their 1989 conviction for murdering their parents. New evidence, including a letter by Erik Menendez alleging sexual abuse by their father, has reignited the case. Gascón emphasized the consideration of abuse claims, recommending 50 years to life.
